content: Spyridon MastorakisSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationWelcome!Spyridon (Spyros) MastorakisPrincipal Researcher @ MicrosoftFor inquiries, please contact me on LinkedIn.IntroductionI am a Principal Researcher at Microsoft, working on AI systems. My academic background includes faculty positions in Computer Science and Engineering at the University of Notre Dame and in Computer Science at the University of Nebraska, where I directed research groups of 10+ members, including software engineering and research staff, postdocs, as well as graduate and undergraduate students. Throughout my academic career, I was awarded multiple grants from federal, state, foundation, and industry sources. I hold a Ph.D. and an M.Sc. in Computer Science from UCLA and an M.Eng. in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the National Technical University of Athens.Select Awards and Distinctions2024: Lucy Family Institute Faculty Fellow2023: IEEE TCSC (Technical Committee on Scalable Computing) Award for Excellence in Scalable Computing (Early Career Researcher) Awarded annually to up to five individuals around the world within 5 years of receiving their PhD degrees “who have made outstanding, influential, and potentially long-lasting contributions in the field of scalable computing”.
